KASARAGOD

Kasaragod

is a district in the northern part of Kerala, bordering Karnataka. It is a land of diverse cultures, languages, religions, and landscapes. It is a place where you can experience the beauty of nature, the charm of history, and the warmth of hospitality. Here are some of the reasons why you should visit Kasaragod:

Bekal Fort

This is the largest and best-preserved fort in Kerala, built in the 17th century by the rulers of the Ikkeri dynasty. It is situated on a rocky promontory overlooking the Arabian Sea, and offers a stunning view of the coastline. The fort has a circular shape, with bastions, observation towers, and a magazine. It also has a mosque, a temple, and a water tank inside. The fort was used as a military base by various powers, including the Portuguese, the Mysore Sultanate, the British, and the Travancore Kingdom. It is now a protected monument and a popular tourist attraction

Ananthapura Lake Temple

This is the only lake temple in Kerala, and the original seat of the deity of the famous Anantha Padmanabha Swamy Temple in Thiruvananthapuram. It is located in a remote village, surrounded by a lake and hills. The temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu, who is depicted as resting on a serpent called Anantha. The temple has a unique architecture, with a sanctum sanctorum that is accessible by a bridge. The temple also has a resident crocodile, named Babia, who is believed to be the guardian of the temple

Chandragiri Fort

This is another historical fort in Kasaragod, built in the 17th century by Sivappa Nayaka, the king of Bednore. It is located on a hill, overlooking the Chandragiri River and the Arabian Sea. The fort has a square shape, with bastions, watchtowers, and a moat. It was used as a strategic point by the Nayakas, the Mysore Sultanate, and the British. It is now a scenic spot, offering a panoramic view of the river, the sea, and the sunset.

Kappil Beach

This is a serene and secluded beach in Kasaragod, ideal for relaxing and rejuvenating. It is a narrow strip of sand, sandwiched between the Arabian Sea and the Kappil Lake. The beach has a calm and clean water, and a golden sand. It is also a good place for swimming, boating, and fishing. The beach is surrounded by coconut groves and casuarina trees, adding to its beauty and tranquility.
